GA improved cell viability, restored mitochondrial dysfunction, and normalized expression of Bax, Bcl-2, cleaved caspase 3 and Cyto C compared with glutamate-treated cells. ERK signaling pathway is essential in GA-mediated neuroprotection. caspase 3 is activated in the cytosol and is translocated into the nucleus to cleave its nuclear substrates. mitochondria-related pathways are involved in GA-mediated neuroprotection. however, the relationship between ERK activation and mitochondrial function needs further study. our findings provide experimental evidence that GA may be a candidate for treating or preventing neurodegenerative diseases.
